alert.note: Alert for Hancock (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 12 at 11:57AM EDT until August 12 at 12:45PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cleveland has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Hancock County in northwestern Ohio... * Until 1245 PM EDT. * At 1156 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Bluffton, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Findlay, Fostoria, Bluffton, Arlington, Arcadia, Rawson, Vanlue, Mount Blanchard, Benton Ridge, Jenera, Mount Cory and Williamstown. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
